Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ```
Hush [HUSH]: Hush recently migrated their codebase from ZEC-forked code, to a codebase derived directly from KMD‚Äôs prior work. Hush has created Hushlist, a means for users to communicate using zero-knowledge technology, similar to mailing lists. This can be used by journalists, whistleblowers, or anyone needing to communicate with many others, in a privacy-sensitive way. According to Hush‚Äôs lead developer, Duke Leto:

    ‚ÄúHush was the first Zcash Protocol coin to remove the 1.6GB download requirement prior to syncing, which in addition to it having the smallest on-disk chain size of ~1GB, makes [it] the most bandwidth-efficient fork‚Äù.
```

Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the day of HUSH/ZEC parity is closing in üòâ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Crypto99> Why is KMD preferred to ZEC?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Crypto99> Being a fork of KMD, instead of ZEC

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Crypto99 purely practical, pragmatic and also philosophic

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Crypto99 i had to do 6 months of work to learn how to add DPoW to the old Hush codebase, we had DPoW, but only sprout. The easiest way to upgrade to Sapling was to become a KMD fork

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that way, as a KMD fork, we get DPoW, Sapling, cryptoconditions, and all the good stuff that KMD has added to ZEC

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> being a plain ZEC fork had no benefits, and actually many downsides

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Crypto99> It sounds like it.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Crypto99> They haven't had JL or you or the KMD crew, working every day to improve. They come through with very nice wallets among other things, but that's not daily work.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> They spend over a million dollars per month

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Given their budget, KMD and HUSH put ZEC to shame with what we produce on a few % of their budget

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Crypto99> We just want $100k, for one year.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Zcash Company, not the foundation, spends $1.1M USD/month, just by itself

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Company+Foundation together are more like $1.5M USD/month, if I had to guess

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the foundation gave us zecwallet, which we forked into SilentDragon, SilentDragonAndroid and SilentDragonLite!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Zcash Foundation pays for code to be written that we actually use

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Zcash Company just writes zcashd, and we don't use that code anymore, except to pull in bugfixes or small features. HUSH does not track ZEC by default

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> most features they add have already been done by KMD, as well

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ZEC is still catching up to KMD

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> new CVEs reported by researchers, those get reported to ZEC so we pull fixes from ZEC

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Hush doesn't even spend anywhere close to $10,000/month on development yet, so we are much greater than 100X more efficient in our budget that Zcash Company

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> We will watch Zcash Company potentially run out of money

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
